alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 2:54PM MST until December 01 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...MAJOR WINTER STORM STARTING TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches along and east of SR-195...3 to 6 inches west of SR-195. * WHERE...Genesee, Plummer, Rosalia, Potlatch, Pullman, Oakesdale, Uniontown, Tekoa, Moscow, La Crosse, and Colfax. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 7 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick. Travel could be very difficult. The wintry conditions will impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Drifting snow is expected and could further complicate travel across the Palouse.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
